intro: Iseilema eremaeum, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that help it store water in harsh environments. The plant produces striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming during the cooler months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and drought. Iseilema eremaeum is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, making it a resilient species in its native ecosystem.
